com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.checking.inline.markings.offset

Interface OffsetEditorView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StyledTextOffsetEditorView

    public interface OffsetEditorView
    The OffsetEditorView is a bridge to the applications document. You must implement this view:
  • if you have an offset based application
  • and using the offset based markings implementation MarkingsFactory.createOffsetMarkings(OffsetCalculator, OffsetMarkingList, OffsetEditorView)
  • and you want your integration be able to change the text of document, like applying suggestions.

    • Method Detail

      • getTextLength

        int getTextLength()
        Returns:
        The complete length of the whole applications document.

      • getCaretOffset

        int getCaretOffset()
        Returns:
        The current offset of the caret.

      • setCaretOffset

        void setCaretOffset(int offset)
        Parameters:
        offset - The new offset of for the caret. This function is called byAcrolinx Java SDK to navigate through the markings.

      • getLocationOnScreen

        Area getLocationOnScreen(Range range)
        Parameters:
        range - The range for lookup.
        Returns:
        The location on screen of the range. This is used to prevent the context menu from hiding the active marking.

      • getSelection

        Range getSelection()
        Returns:
        The current text selection.

      • replace

        void replace(Range range,
           String replacement)
        This method replaces a Range in application documents text with a new replacement. This is used for applying suggestion or deleting parts of text. In this case the replacement is empty but not null.
        Parameters:
        range - - end offset is excluding

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly(Set<Range> ranges)
        This method is used to verify if a replacement could be applied or the edit command could be performed.
        Parameters:
        ranges - The Ranges to be check for read only.
        Returns:
        true, if one part of one of the ranges is read only.

        void removeCheckingStatus()
